behaviors-manifest.purpose: Index of all available behaviors. The orchestrator reads this at session start to know what behaviors exist. Load individual behavior files on demand when composing agent instructions — do not read all behavior files upfront.
behaviors-manifest.behavior: Branching strategies (trunk-based, feature branching), branch naming conventions, commit message format, push discipline, and beads issue-type integration.
Failure protocol for all agent types. Retry rules, structured failure reports, model-tier escalation chains (light → worker → reasoning → human).
File scope limits and out-of-scope discovery reporting. Prevents scope creep at both orchestrator and agent level. Agents only modify assigned files.
Post and update sub-task progress as structured comments on beads tickets. Timeline of progress preserved as sequential comments.
Documentation model for single-project and monorepo layouts. Defines where docs live (README → INDEX → ARCHITECTURE → service docs) and organizing principles.
Pull request body template: summary, changes table, AI suggested testing plan, ticket link. Used by the PR drafter to compose the PR description.
Defines what a human gate is, the approval protocol (approve/reject/abort), and lifecycle-specific gate contexts defining what to present at each gate.
Standard response format for all agents. Every message prefixed with LIFECYCLE: {name} // {message} so humans can track active phases.
Rules, constraints, and XML skeleton template for writing behavior files. Covers self-containment, naming, structural complexity, rule formatting, and how to register new behaviors in the manifest.

Rules, constraints, and XML skeleton template for writing lifecycle files. Covers behavior referencing, phase structure, actor specificity, flow diagrams, naming conventions, and how to register new lifecycles in the manifest.

Protocol for waiting on CI/CD status checks after a pull request is created. Covers how to poll for check results, interpret outcomes, and structure reports for passed, failed, and no-checks-configured scenarios.
